text: Caerwys Tufa is a Site of Special Scientific Interest in the preserved county of Clwyd, north Wales. Tufa, a very soft limestone that was once used to make cement, and later, widely used in alpine gardens, was extracted at Caerwys Tufa Quarry.http://www.flintshire.gov.uk/en/PDFFiles/Tourism/Discover- Caerwys.pdf ==See also== *List of Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Clwyd ==References== Category:Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Clwyd Category:Caerwys
title: Caerwys Tufa
